posts.title: Welcome Home Shiloh's
posts.content:
After a two month hiatus, Broken Arrow home-style staple, Shiloh’s, is set to reopen on Thursday, November 3rd at 7a.m. 

  • 20 Years Strong: The comfort food mecca has been cooking up favorites like chicken fried steak and their award winning rolls since 2000 and don't worry - they will not be changing their beloved menu.
  • Gobble: Shiloh's will be open Thanksgiving Day and have just started taking taking catering orders for the holidays as well. 

Check them out HERE.

posts.title: Holiday Cheer Starts Here
posts.content:
The holiday season is already upon us and we’re just grateful that someone has already made the bucket list for us. Here are a few events to get you in the spirit:

  • Light Up: On November 24th at 6:30pm, Utica Square will be hosting one of Tulsa’s favorite traditions, Lights On. Bundle up, grab a good spot in line for Santa’s House and soak in the famous white lights as the Christmas season rolls in. 
  • Cotton Headed Ninny Muggins: Enjoy John Debney’s score as Elf (everyone’s favorite Christmas movie) plays on the big screen at the Tulsa Performing Arts on December 2nd at 7:30pm. 

Your full list of festivities can be found HERE.

posts.title: Our Town Return To Tulsa Theatre
posts.content:
Tulsa Theatre will perform Thorton Wilder's Our Town November 11-20th. 

  • Small Town Charm: The three-act play, set from 1901 to 1913, tells the story of a fictional American town named Grover’s Corner, through the stories of it's residents. 
  • A Legacy: 80-years-ago, Theatre Tulsa was the first venue to perform the famed tragi-comedy away from Broadway and now it’s back to celebrate. 

Read more about it HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Woman up: Give your startup the boost it needs by applying for the 2023 EMPOWER Cohort, offered to all women by Startup Junkie and Science Venture Studio.* 
  • Pickin time: The Ozark Folk Festival kicks off this weekend, Nov 10-12, bringing three days of the best regional and national folk music to the Aud in Eureka Spring.* 
  • Seniority: The Adult Wellness Center in Rogers hosts a variety of awesome activities and classes for people aged 50+.
  • Football for everyone: 4029 News featured this elementary's after-school program that helps children with special needs play sports through inclusive flag football.
  • Tell it: Have a story? We have room in the newsletter for you! Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
